pullrequest.title: Add cppcheck rules to prevent identifiers starting with _[A-Z]

content.raw:
Yeah, I thought about it but I'm not sure how to write a rule that would catch those. I went ahead with these rules since I noticed that gazebo violates them ([World::_SetSensorsInitialized](https://bitbucket.org/osrf/gazebo/src/86f56413ee8f0a656982353c54f1347d4b716b68/gazebo/physics/World.cc?fileviewer=file-view-default#World.cc-610)) but thought it would be easier to start at the bottom and propagate them around.

Actually it would be nice if we could share these cppcheck rules between our packages instead of duplicating them, but I'm not sure how to do that. Maybe make a package called `ignition-style`?
content.html:
Yeah, I thought about it but I'm not sure how to write a rule that would catch those. I went ahead with these rules since I noticed that gazebo violates them (World::_SetSensorsInitialized) but thought it would be easier to start at the bottom and propagate them around.

Actually it would be nice if we could share these cppcheck rules between our packages instead of duplicating them, but I'm not sure how to do that. Maybe make a package called ignition-style?
